Mesh Class Reference
[Hierarchical graphics library]

#include <Mesh.h>

Inheritance diagram for Mesh:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Container for visual primitives.

Member Function Documentation

void Mesh::addBone ( Node *  bone,
const NS(math, float3x4)&  invresttm 
)

Adds a bone to the mesh.

Parameters:
bone Bone node.
invresttm Transform from skin to bone space in non-deforming pose.

void Mesh::addLight ( Light *  lt  ) 

Adds a local light to this mesh.

Local light affects only this mesh. If the mesh has no local lights, then closest lights are retrieved from the scene in run-time. As this causes some performance penalty and is less predictable in terms of visual output, it is usually best always to use local lights if possible.

virtual Node* Mesh::clone (  )  const [virtual]

Returns clone of this node.

Clones child nodes as well.

void Mesh::getBoneMatrix4x3Array ( Camera *  camera,
NS(math, float4x4)*  tm,
int  count 
) const

Returns model->world transforms for n bones.

Matrices are returned in modified 4x3 format, i.e. translation at row 3, X-axis at column 0. Camera transform cache must contain valid world transforms of the node hierarchy. This can be ensured by calling NS(Camera,cacheTransforms)() before this method.

Light* Mesh::getLight ( int  i  )  const

Returns ith local light from this mesh.

See also:
addLight

void Mesh::getShaders ( NS(lang, Array)< NS(gr, Shader)* > &  shaders  ) 

Returns array of shaders used by this visual.

NOTE: Implementation should not clear the list of returned shaders before adding new ones, since shadesr from multiple Visuals might be collected at the same time.
